concept.title: T.I.P.S.
concept.shortdesc: T.I.P.S. is the minimum requirements for Token Layer as defined in the TokenScript Design Paper

row.entry: Blockchain data can be easily subverted at the UI layer on websites.

ul.li: TokenScript organise UI into cards, runing in a secure environment separated from the underlying website.
A data layer provides true blockchain data to the Cards.

row.entry: Difficult to guarantee token behaviour across websites. Websites has to know a token to use it.

ul.li: Token logics are packaged into TokenScripts. Users can upgrade from their side.
Token Negotiation allows onboarding of new tokens and attestations.

row.entry: Website knows everything about the user from just their Ethereum address.

ul.li: Cards run from secure, private environment and only outputs proofs to the websites, paving the way for privacy enabled tokens.
Attestation allows user holding tokens not linked to his address on the blockchain.

row.entry: User has to trust the website is securely generating transactions for his token. Such trust is hard to gain unless the website is from the token issuer.

ul.li: TokenScript allows transaction to be generated in a secure environment following predefined template, by the code trusted from the smart contract author, no matter which website uses the token.
In the future, TokenScript will support DvP Security further securing transaction even if it is passed on from an untrusted contract.

conbody.p: On top of TIPS, there are 2 lesser requirements that didn't make it into the acronym:

dlentry.dd: Tokens should work as long as the underlying blockchain smart contracts are working, not depending on the availability of specific websites.
Allow the use of attestation over transactions.
